---
title: "Installation Guide"
description: "Complete installation guide for the Reasoning Kernel with multiple deployment options and environment configurations."
---

## System Requirements

Before installing the Reasoning Kernel, ensure your system meets these requirements:

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Minimum Requirements">
    - **Python**: 3.12 or later
    - **Memory**: 4GB RAM minimum
    - **Storage**: 2GB free space
    - **Network**: Internet connection for API services
    - **OS**: Linux, macOS, or Windows with WSL2
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Recommended Requirements">
    - **Python**: 3.12+ with async support
    - **Memory**: 8GB RAM or more
    - **Storage**: 10GB free space
    - **CPU**: Multi-core processor for parallel reasoning
    - **GPU**: Optional, for local model inference
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Production Requirements">
    - **Python**: 3.12+ with production optimizations
    - **Memory**: 16GB+ RAM
    - **Storage**: 50GB+ with SSD
    - **CPU**: 8+ cores for concurrent processing
    - **Network**: Low-latency connection to cloud services
    - **Container**: Docker and Kubernetes support
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Installation Methods

### Method 1: pip Installation (Recommended)

The simplest way to install the Reasoning Kernel:

```bash
# Install the latest stable version
pip install reasoning-kernel

# Install with all optional dependencies
pip install reasoning-kernel[all]

# Install specific features
pip install reasoning-kernel[redis,sandbox,monitoring]
```

<Tip>
Use `pip install reasoning-kernel[all]` to get all optional dependencies including Redis support, sandbox execution, and monitoring capabilities.
</Tip>

### Method 2: uv Installation (Fastest)

For the fastest installation and dependency management:

```bash
# Install uv if not already installed
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

# Create a new project
uv init my-reasoning-project
cd my-reasoning-project

# Add reasoning-kernel
uv add reasoning-kernel

# Add optional dependencies
uv add reasoning-kernel --extra redis,sandbox
```

### Method 3: Development Installation

For contributors and advanced users:

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/qredence/reasoning-kernel.git
cd reasoning-kernel

# Install with uv (recommended)
uv sync --dev

# Or with pip
pip install -e ".[dev,test,docs]"
```

### Method 4: Docker Installation

Run the Reasoning Kernel in a containerized environment:

<CodeGroup>
```dockerfile Dockerfile
FROM python:3.12-slim

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    curl \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install uv
COPY --from=ghcr.io/astral-sh/uv:latest /uv /usr/local/bin/uv

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Copy requirements
COPY pyproject.toml uv.lock ./

# Install dependencies
RUN uv sync --frozen

# Copy application code
COPY . .

# Install reasoning-kernel
RUN uv pip install -e .

# Expose port
EXPOSE 8000

# Run application
CMD ["uv", "run", "reasoning-kernel", "serve"]
```

```yaml docker-compose.yml
version: '3.8'
services:
  reasoning-kernel:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "8000:8000"
    environment:
      - GEMINI_API_KEY=${GEMINI_API_KEY}
      - REDIS_URL=redis://redis:6379
    depends_on:
      - redis
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data

  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes

volumes:
  redis_data:
```

```bash Commands
# Build and run with Docker Compose
docker-compose up -d

# Or run with Docker directly
docker build -t reasoning-kernel .
docker run -p 8000:8000 -e GEMINI_API_KEY=$GEMINI_API_KEY reasoning-kernel
```
</CodeGroup>

## Dependency Management

The Reasoning Kernel uses modern Python packaging with optional dependencies:

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Core Dependencies">
    ```toml pyproject.toml
    [project]
    dependencies = [
        "semantic-kernel>=1.35.3",
        "pydantic>=2.0",
        "httpx>=0.25",
        "jax>=0.4.20",
        "numpyro>=0.13",
        "networkx>=3.0",
    ]
    ```
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Optional Dependencies">
    ```toml Optional Features
    [project.optional-dependencies]
    redis = [
        "redis>=5.0",
        "redis-om>=0.2"
    ]
    sandbox = [
        "daytona-sdk>=1.0"
    ]
    monitoring = [
        "prometheus-client>=0.17",
        "opentelemetry-api>=1.20"
    ]
    visualization = [
        "matplotlib>=3.7",
        "plotly>=5.15"
    ]
    all = [
        "reasoning-kernel[redis,sandbox,monitoring,visualization]"
    ]
    ```
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Development Dependencies">
    ```toml Development
    [project.optional-dependencies]
    dev = [
        "pytest>=7.4",
        "pytest-asyncio>=0.21",
        "black>=23.0",
        "isort>=5.12",
        "mypy>=1.5",
        "pre-commit>=3.4"
    ]
    test = [
        "pytest-cov>=4.1",
        "pytest-mock>=3.11",
        "hypothesis>=6.82"
    ]
    docs = [
        "mkdocs>=1.5",
        "mkdocs-material>=9.2"
    ]
    ```
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Environment Configuration

### Environment Variables

Set up your environment variables for the services you'll use:

<CodeGroup>
```bash .env.example
# Required: Gemini AI for reasoning and embeddings
GEMINI_API_KEY=your_gemini_api_key_here

# Optional: Redis for enhanced memory
REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379
REDIS_PASSWORD=your_redis_password

# Optional: Azure OpenAI as fallback
AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY=your_azure_api_key
AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT=https://your-resource.openai.azure.com/
AZURE_OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT=gpt-4

# Optional: Daytona sandbox for secure execution
DAYTONA_API_KEY=your_daytona_api_key
DAYTONA_WORKSPACE_ID=your_workspace_id

# Optional: Monitoring and telemetry
ENABLE_TELEMETRY=true
LOG_LEVEL=INFO
PROMETHEUS_PORT=9090
```

```python config.py
import os
from reasoning_kernel import ReasoningKernelConfig

# Load configuration from environment
config = ReasoningKernelConfig(
    # AI Services
    gemini_api_key=os.getenv("GEMINI_API_KEY"),
    azure_openai_api_key=os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY"),
    azure_openai_endpoint=os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT"),
    
    # Memory
    redis_url=os.getenv("REDIS_URL"),
    redis_password=os.getenv("REDIS_PASSWORD"),
    
    # Sandbox
    daytona_api_key=os.getenv("DAYTONA_API_KEY"),
    daytona_workspace_id=os.getenv("DAYTONA_WORKSPACE_ID"),
    
    # Monitoring
    enable_telemetry=os.getenv("ENABLE_TELEMETRY", "false").lower() == "true",
    log_level=os.getenv("LOG_LEVEL", "INFO"),
)
```
</CodeGroup>

### Configuration Files

Create configuration files for different environments:

<CodeGroup>
```yaml config/development.yaml
reasoning_kernel:
  ai_services:
    gemini:
      model: "gemini-2.5-pro"
      enable_thinking: true
      temperature: 0.7
    
  memory:
    type: "local"
    cache_size: 1000
    persistence_file: "./dev_cache.json"
  
  sandbox:
    enabled: false
  
  logging:
    level: "DEBUG"
    format: "detailed"
```

```yaml config/production.yaml
reasoning_kernel:
  ai_services:
    gemini:
      model: "gemini-2.5-pro"
      enable_thinking: true
      temperature: 0.3
      rate_limit: 100
    azure_openai:
      deployment: "gpt-4"
      fallback_enabled: true
  
  memory:
    type: "redis"
    redis_url: "${REDIS_URL}"
    short_term_ttl: 3600
    long_term_ttl: null
    enable_clustering: true
  
  sandbox:
    enabled: true
    provider: "daytona"
    timeout: 300
    resource_limits:
      memory: "2GB"
      cpu: "1"
  
  monitoring:
    enabled: true
    prometheus_port: 9090
    tracing_enabled: true
  
  logging:
    level: "INFO"
    format: "json"
```
</CodeGroup>

## Verification

Verify your installation is working correctly:

<Steps>
  <Step title="Basic Import Test">
    ```python test_import.py
    try:
        from reasoning_kernel import ReasoningKernel
        print("✅ Reasoning Kernel imported successfully")
    except ImportError as e:
        print(f"❌ Import failed: {e}")
    ```
  </Step>
  
  <Step title="Dependencies Check">
    ```python test_dependencies.py
    import importlib
    
    dependencies = [
        "semantic_kernel",
        "pydantic", 
        "jax",
        "numpyro",
        "networkx"
    ]
    
    for dep in dependencies:
        try:
            importlib.import_module(dep)
            print(f"✅ {dep}")
        except ImportError:
            print(f"❌ {dep} not found")
    ```
  </Step>
  
  <Step title="Configuration Test">
    ```python test_config.py
    from reasoning_kernel import ReasoningKernel
    import asyncio
    
    async def test_config():
        try:
            kernel = ReasoningKernel()
            health = await kernel.health_check()
            
            print("✅ Kernel initialized successfully")
            print(f"Status: {health.status}")
            print(f"Services: {', '.join(health.services)}")
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"❌ Configuration test failed: {e}")
    
    asyncio.run(test_config())
    ```
  </Step>
  
  <Step title="Integration Test">
    ```python test_integration.py
    from reasoning_kernel import ReasoningKernel
    import asyncio
    
    async def test_reasoning():
        kernel = ReasoningKernel()
        
        try:
            result = await kernel.reason(
                "Test reasoning: What is 2+2?",
                timeout=30
            )
            
            print("✅ Basic reasoning test passed")
            print(f"Result: {result.reasoning_result}")
            print(f"Confidence: {result.confidence}")
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"❌ Reasoning test failed: {e}")
    
    asyncio.run(test_reasoning())
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Troubleshooting

Common installation issues and solutions:

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Python Version Issues" icon="python">
    ```bash
    # Check Python version
    python --version
    
    # Install Python 3.12 with pyenv
    pyenv install 3.12.0
    pyenv global 3.12.0
    
    # Or use conda
    conda create -n reasoning python=3.12
    conda activate reasoning
    ```
  </Accordion>
  
  <Accordion title="Dependency Conflicts" icon="exclamation-triangle">
    ```bash
    # Clear pip cache
    pip cache purge
    
    # Use virtual environment
    python -m venv venv
    source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
    
    # Install with uv for better dependency resolution
    pip install uv
    uv pip install reasoning-kernel
    ```
  </Accordion>
  
  <Accordion title="JAX/NumPyro Issues" icon="calculator">
    ```bash
    # Install JAX for your platform
    # CPU only
    pip install jax[cpu]
    
    # GPU (CUDA)
    pip install jax[cuda12]
    
    # Apple Silicon Mac
    pip install jax[metal]
    ```
  </Accordion>
  
  <Accordion title="Redis Connection Issues" icon="database">
    ```bash
    # Test Redis connection
    redis-cli ping
    
    # Install Redis locally
    # macOS
    brew install redis
    brew services start redis
    
    # Ubuntu/Debian
    sudo apt install redis-server
    sudo systemctl start redis
    
    # Or use Docker
    docker run -p 6379:6379 redis:7-alpine
    ```
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Platform-Specific Notes

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="macOS">
    ```bash
    # Install with Homebrew (recommended)
    brew install python@3.12
    pip3.12 install reasoning-kernel
    
    # For Apple Silicon Macs
    pip install jax[metal]  # GPU acceleration
    ```
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Linux">
    ```bash
    # Ubuntu/Debian
    sudo apt update
    sudo apt install python3.12 python3.12-pip python3.12-dev
    pip3.12 install reasoning-kernel
    
    # CentOS/RHEL
    sudo dnf install python3.12 python3.12-pip python3.12-devel
    ```
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Windows">
    ```powershell
    # Install with Microsoft Store or python.org
    # Then use pip in PowerShell or Command Prompt
    pip install reasoning-kernel
    
    # Or use WSL2 (recommended for development)
    wsl --install Ubuntu
    # Then follow Linux instructions
    ```
  </Tab>
</Tabs>
